p: In immunocompetent patients, the diagnosis is based on the presence of IgM antibodies (Knipe and Howley 2007). The presence of IgG alone may only suggest previous infection. The virus can be detected by the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay for months to years after infection. There may be a transient drop in the reticulocyte count and hemoglobulin concentration in week 1 or 2, but the numbers normalize after a month (Doyle et al. 2000).
